DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis is that different concentrations of nucleotides' supplementation of an infant formula might affect differently growth and/or other clinical parameters in neonates.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Effects of a Nucleotides-Supplemented Infant Formula
DOC.detailed_description: Three groups of 50 newborn infants each, will be fed for 30 days an infant formula supplemented with either 4.9 mg/100 kcal or 10.6 mg/100 kcal of nucleotides or with no supplementation. Newborns will be monitored prospectively for the following outcome parameters: - Growth percentiles. - Behaviour and infantile colic. - Bowel habits. - Side effects.
DOC.criteria: Healthy newborns aged 030 days. Prematurity Chronic illness Failure to thrive Milk allergy
